Dublin to Belfast Train Information

The mind-boggling landscapes of Ireland and its neighboring country will undoubtedly leave a lasting impression while on a train ride from Dublin to Belfast. Providing not only scenic views but a rapid and comfortable journey as well, train travel is one of the best ways to conquer the distance. There are several daily connections, which take around two hours to complete. Using Rail Ninja service, you can find more information about the route, browse the timetable, and easily purchase your Dublin to Belfast train tickets. Make your travel plans more far-reaching with Ireland itinerary planner. Follow to explore the most popular Ireland attractions and activities and build your own unforgettable trip!

Is there a direct train from Dublin to Belfast?

As mentioned above, the railway route between the beautiful cities is served by fast Irish high-speed trains. They boast fast travel times and can take you from Ireland to Northern Ireland in just a bit over two hours, no train changes needed.

How much is a train from Dublin to Belfast?

Unfortunately, to give a suitable-for-all-situations answer to this question is impossible. The cost of Dublin to Belfast train depends on a lot of factors. The last-minute tickets, for example, cost quite a bit more than the rail tickets you booked in advance. First-Class tickets are a bit more pricey than their second-class counterpart. Even the time of departure can influence the price, as late-night trains are sometimes cheaper. On average, the Dublin - Belfast train ticket cost is around 40 USD for a one-way ticket.

Popular Train Routes From Dublin and Belfast

Have you ever been dreaming about your unforgettable vacation in Ireland? When planning a trip to this unique part of the United Kingdom, the best option is to see the northern expanses on 2-hours journey by Dublin to Belfast train. Go to the capital of Ireland, visit the Guinness Beer Museum, admire St. Patrick's Cathedral, and then travel to Northern Ireland!

Belfast will amaze you with picturesque temples and palaces, fascinating museums, theaters, the famous "Big Fish," and many other extravaganzas. Ireland has a lot of incredibly interesting places that every traveler should visit! Get your adventure in the land of leprechauns and shamrocks right now - check out the most popular trains from Dublin to Belfast and choose your perfect option!
